result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence A. STOKES Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, defendant entered a plea in Case No. 15 CM 109.   Court grants the motion.   
Minutes.
Status conference set for 07-28-15 at 3:45 p.m.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-10-15 at 3:15 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of obstruct officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-06-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $300.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
